io.hekate.network

Interface NetworkClient<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Base type of messages that can be sent/received by this NetworkClient. Note that NetworkClient must be configured to use a Codec which is capable of serializing messages of this type.
    All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable, NetworkEndpoint<T>

    public interface NetworkClient<T>
extends NetworkEndpoint<T>, Closeable
    Asynchronous network client connection.

    Note: for generic overview of networking and usage example please see the documentation of NetworkService.

    Instantiation

    Instances of this interface can be obtained via NetworkConnector.newClient() method.

    Connecting and disconnecting

    Each NetworkClient instance manages a single NIO channel that is created when connect(...) method is called and destroyed when NetworkEndpoint.disconnect() is called. Both of those methods are asynchronous and return a future object that can be used get asynchronous operation results.

    connect(...) method accepts an instance of NetworkClientCallback interface that can be used to get notified upon state() connection state} changes and listen for incoming messages from server.

    When NetworkClient instance is not needed anymore it must be disconnected by calling its NetworkEndpoint.disconnect() method in order to release system resources.

    Its is possible to re-connect the same NetworkClient instance (even to a different address), assuming that such client is in disconnected state before trying to establish a new connection.

    Sending and receiving messages

    Messages sending can be done by calling NetworkEndpoint.send(Object, NetworkSendCallback) method that accepts a message to be sent and a callback that will be notified upon operation completion. Note that message sending operation is asynchronous and doesn't block the caller thread.

    Note: After connect(...) method is called it is possible to start sending messages immediately without awaiting for operation completion. Such messages will be kept in the internal buffer and will be asynchronously sent once the TCP connection is established (or will fail in case of connection error).

    Receiving messages from server can be done by providing an instance of NetworkClientCallback while connecting and implementing its NetworkClientCallback.onMessage(NetworkMessage, NetworkClient) method. This method gets notified on every message that gets received by the NetworkClient instance from a server.

    Messages serialization

    Messages serialization and deserialization is handled by the CodecFactory interface. Implementations of this interface can be registered via NetworkConnectorConfig.setMessageCodec(CodecFactory) method. Every time when NetworkClient establishes a new connection it uses this factory to create an instance of Codec that will performs actual data encoding and decoding.

    Thread safety

    NetworkClient is thread safe and can be called by multiple threads in parallel.

    See Also:
    NetworkService, NetworkConnector

      Asynchronously established a new socket connection to a NetworkService at the specified address.

      Same as connect(InetSocketAddress, Object, NetworkClientCallback) but does nothing if client is already in NetworkClient.State.CONNECTING or NetworkClient.State.CONNECTED state.

      Returns the connection state.

      • Methods inherited from interface io.hekate.network.NetworkEndpoint

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        NetworkFuture<T> connect(InetSocketAddress address,
                         NetworkClientCallback<T> callback)
                  throws IllegalStateException
        Asynchronously established a new socket connection to a NetworkService at the specified address.

        If operation completes successfully then NetworkClientCallback.onConnect(NetworkClient) will be notified. If operation completes with an error then NetworkClientCallback.onDisconnect(NetworkClient, Optional) will be notified.

        Note that it is possible to start sending messages without awaiting for completion of this operation. Such messages will be buffered and submitted once this operation completes.

        Parameters:
        address - Socket address where NetworkService is running.
        callback - Connection callback.
        Returns:
        Future object that can be used to obtain result of this operation.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown if this NetworkClient is already in NetworkClient.State.CONNECTING or NetworkClient.State.CONNECTED state.

      • connect

        NetworkFuture<T> connect(InetSocketAddress address,
                         T login,
                         NetworkClientCallback<T> callback)
                  throws IllegalStateException
        Asynchronously established a new socket connection to a NetworkService at the specified address and submits an optional login message. This message will be passed to the NetworkServerHandler.onConnect(Object, NetworkEndpoint) method at the received side.

        If operation completes successfully then NetworkClientCallback.onConnect(NetworkClient) will be notified. If operation completes with an error then NetworkClientCallback.onConnect(NetworkClient) will be notified.

        Parameters:
        address - Socket address where NetworkService is running.
        login - Login message that should be passed to the NetworkServerHandler.onConnect(Object, NetworkEndpoint) method. Can be null.
        callback - Connection callback.
        Returns:
        Future object that can be used to obtain result of this operation.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown if this NetworkClient is already in NetworkClient.State.CONNECTING or NetworkClient.State.CONNECTED state.

      • ensureConnected

        NetworkFuture<T> ensureConnected(InetSocketAddress address,
                                 NetworkClientCallback<T> callback)
        Same as connect(InetSocketAddress, NetworkClientCallback) but does nothing if client is already in NetworkClient.State.CONNECTING or NetworkClient.State.CONNECTED state.
        Parameters:
        address - Socket address where NetworkService is running.
        callback - Connection callback.
        Returns:
        Future object that can be used to obtain result of this operation.

      • ensureConnected

        NetworkFuture<T> ensureConnected(InetSocketAddress address,
                                 T login,
                                 NetworkClientCallback<T> callback)
        Same as connect(InetSocketAddress, Object, NetworkClientCallback) but does nothing if client is already in NetworkClient.State.CONNECTING or NetworkClient.State.CONNECTED state.
        Parameters:
        address - Socket address where NetworkService is running.
        login - Login message that should be passed to the NetworkServerHandler.onConnect(Object, NetworkEndpoint) method. Can be null.
        callback - Connection callback.
        Returns:
        Future object that can be used to obtain result of this operation.

      • state

        NetworkClient.State state()
        Returns the connection state.
        Returns:
        Connection state.
